info.title: Listrak Email REST API
info.description:
# Introduction Welcome to the Listrak Email REST API! Our API allows developers to integrate with Listrak's application. It enables the seamless automation of a broad set of functionality, ranging from basic tasks to complex processes. We aim to provide comprehensive documentation coverage of our API's capabilities. Each resource and method is described in detail with implementation notes, descriptions of parameters, headers, return values, and code samples to aid in development. # Versioning The API version is denoted in the URI. This API's base URI is: `https://api.listrak.com/email/v1`
The API version will be incremented if breaking changes are introduced. Breaking changes may include: - Addition of required headers, parameters, or model fields to a current route - Alterations that would result in currently valid requests failing, or performing unexpectedly
Changes that are not considered breaking may include: - Addition of new model fields - Addition of new routes - Addition of new response headers - Any alteration to a route that is marked as In Development # Usage ## External Libraries The C# code examples featured on this site require the following packages: - Microsoft.AspNet.WebApi.Client - Newtonsoft.Json The Php code examples require the following package: - Guzzle 6 # Feedback We are actively seeking feedback in the following areas: - Code samples - Response examples - Resource and field descriptions
Please provide your feedback to us at restapifeedback@listrak.com. # Integration Setup To enable API access, **you must create an _Integration_** on the _Integrations_ page. In the Listrak application on the navigation bar go to: Manage → Integrations. Please specify integration type `Email` for your integration. You must also specify which areas of the API should be made accessible. Available areas include: - Contact - Event - List - Message - Reporting - Segmentation Make sure to securely store a copy of your _Client ID_ and _Client Secret_. These values will be needed to authenticate with the API. For your security, the _Client Secret_ cannot be retrieved if it is lost. # Status Codes | Status Code | Status | Description | |-|-|-| | 200 | OK | The request succeeded. | | 201 | Created | A new resource has been created. | | 400 | Bad Request | Your request is malformed or invalid. | | 401 | Unauthorized | Authentication is required. | | 404 | Not Found | The resource does not exist. | | 405 | Method Not Allowed | The route does not support the requested method. | | 415 | Unsupported Media Type | Please use a `Content-Type` of `application/json`. | | 500 | Internal Server Error | An unexpected error occurred. Our development team has been notified. | # Error Codes ## General | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_INVALID_CREDENTIALS | Invalid client credentials, inactive integration, unauthorized IP address | | ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER | Null or invalid value for a parameter, non-unique value for a parameter (if the property is required to be unique for all resources in the collection) | | ERROR_MALFORMED_REQUEST_BODY | Invalid JSON body was supplied | | ERROR_RESOURCE_DEPENDENCY | Trying to delete a resource that is in use | | ERROR_UNABLE_TO_LOCATE_RESOURCE | Valid route was supplied with invalid resource IDs | | ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED | Invalid access token, inactive integration, insufficient access level, unauthorized IP address | | ERROR_UNHANDLED_EXCEPTION | Unexpected error during execution of the request | | ERROR_UNKNOWN_ROUTE | Invalid route was supplied | | ERROR_UNSAFE_ROUTE | Invalid character was supplied in the route ('&' outside of query string, '<', '>', etc.) | | ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_CONTENT_TYPE | Invalid `Content-Type` header was supplied (must be `application/json`), missing `Content-Type` header | | ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_METHOD | Valid route supplied with an invalid HTTP method | | ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_PROTOCOL | Request was not made over HTTPS | ## Contact | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_BANNED_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Subscribing a contact that has been banned | | ERROR_BANNED_NEW_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Changing `emailAddress` to one that has been banned | | ERROR_CHANGE_ADDRESS_CONTACT_UNSUBSCRIBED | Changing `emailAddress` to one that has unsubscribed from the list | | ERROR_CHANGE_ADDRESS_WITH_EVENTS | Changing `emailAddress` with a list of events | | ERROR_CHANGE_ADDRESS_WITH_SEGMENTATION_DATA | Changing `emailAddress` with profile data | | ERROR_CONVERSION_ANALYTICS_NOT_ENABLED | Conversion analytics not enabled | | ERROR_NOT_SUBSCRIBED_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Unsubscribing a contact that is not a subscriber for the list | | ERROR_PENDING_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Already pending subscription through double opt-in | | ERROR_PENDING_NEW_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Changing `emailAddress` to one that is already pending subscription through double opt-in | | ERROR_SUBSCRIBED_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Subscribing a contact that has already been subscribed to the list | | ERROR_SUBSCRIBED_NEW_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Changing `emailAddress` to one that is already subscribed to the list | | ERROR_SUPPRESSED_EMAIL | Subscribing an `emailAddress` that has already been suppressed | | ERROR_SUPPRESSED_NEW_EMAIL | Changing `emailAddress` to one that has already been suppressed | | ERROR_TOO_MANY_SEGMENTATION_FIELDS | Number of requested profile fields exceeds the limit | | ERROR_UNSUBSCRIBE_WITH_EVENTS | Unsubscribing a contact with a list of events | | ERROR_UNSUBSCRIBE_WITH_SEGMENTATION_DATA | Unsubscribing a contact with profile data | | ERROR_UNSUBSCRIBED_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Unsubscribing a contact that has already been unsubscribed from the list | | ERROR_UNSUBSCRIBED_NEW_EMAIL_ADDRESS | Changing an `emailAddress` to one that has already been unsubscribed from the list | | ERROR_UPDATE_UNSUBSCRIBE_WITH_EVENTS | Updating a contact that is unsubscribed with a list of events | ## List | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_GOOGLE_TRACKING_DOMAIN_LIMIT_MET | Maximum number of Google tracking domains have already been set for the list | | ERROR_DOMAIN_ALIAS_INVALID | The provided domain alias is not a valid domain | | ERROR_DOMAIN_ALIAS_MISCONFIGURED_DNS | The DNS record for the provided domain alias does not point to the correct endpoint | | ERROR_DOMAIN_ALIAS_INVALID_HSTS | The provided domain alias has HSTS enabled for either all sub-domains, or a domain alias type we are unable to secure | | ERROR_DOMAIN_ALIAS_PROXY_CERTIFICATE_GENEREATION_FAILED | We were unable to secure the specfied domain alias | ## Message | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_REVIEW_FLAG_AND_SEND_DATE_SET | `sendReviewMessage` set to true and `sendDate` is set | | ERROR_TEST_FLAG_AND_REVIEW_FLAG_SET | `sendReviewMessage` and `sendTestMessage` set to true | | ERROR_TEST_FLAG_AND_SEND_DATE_SET | `sendTestMessage` set to true and `sendDate` is set | ## Segmentation Field Group | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_SEGMENTATION_FIELD_GROUP_LIMIT_MET | Maximum number of profile field groups have already been created for the list | ## Transactional Message | Error Code | Possible Causes | |-|-| | ERROR_SEGMENTATION_FIELD_DEFINED_TWICE | Two or more values were supplied for the same `segmentationFieldId` | | ERROR_TRANSACTIONAL_MESSAGE_EXTERNAL_CONTENT | Contains external content tags | | ERROR_TRANSACTIONAL_MESSAGE_SYSTEM_LINK | Contains system link tags | # Parameters ## Route Parameters Resource identifiers are specified in the route. For example, in the route `/Resource/{resourceId}`, `resourceId` is a route parameter. In this example, if you wish to interact with Resource #123, its route would be `/Resource/123`. ## Query Parameters Some routes support additional query parameters; for example, some resources support query parameters relating to paging. Supported query parameters are described in their respective documentation areas. ## Request Body Request bodies are required for most `POST` and `PUT` requests. Please use a `Content-Type` of `application/json` and provide a JSON object in your request body. The maximum accepted request body size is 250 MB (262,144,000 bytes). Headers are not counted against this limit. Requests larger than this limit will result in a `404 Not Found` response.

get.description: Returns the collection of contacts associated with the specified list.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: Identifier used to locate the list.

parameters.name: subscriptionState
parameters.description: Identifier used to specify subscription state of the contacts to retrieve. Allowed values are `Subscribed` and `Unsubscribed`. The default value is `Subscribed`.

parameters.name: segmentationFieldIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of profile field IDs to retrieve. Up to 30 fields may be included.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Value indicating the page of data that's being retrieved. The default value is `Start`.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Number of data members to be displayed per page. The default value is `1000` and the maximum value is `5000`.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date that's being used to filter the data members. This applies to subscribe date when retrieving subscribed contacts. Applies to unsubscribe date when retrieving unsubscribed contacts.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date that's being used to filter the data members. This applies to subscribe date when retrieving subscribed contacts. Applies to unsubscribe date when retrieving unsubscribed contacts.

application/json.message: An invalid value was supplied for {Parameter}.
Unable to locate a resource associated with the listId supplied.
Authorization was denied for this request.

post.description: Creates or updates a contact on the specified list.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: Identifier used to locate the list.

parameters.name: contactResource
parameters.description: Representation of the contact to create or update.

parameters.name: eventIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of event identifiers that should be raised after the contact is created or updated.

parameters.name: overrideUnsubscribe
parameters.description: Whether a contact in an unsubscribed state should be forced to a subscribed state. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: subscribedByContact
parameters.description: Whether the subscribe was initiated by the contact. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: sendDoubleOptIn
parameters.description: Whether a double opt-in email should be sent if a new contact is being created. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: updateType
parameters.description: If updating an existing contact, the type of update that will be performed on any submitted profile fields. Allowed values are `Update`, `Append`, and `Overwrite`. The default value is `Update`.

parameters.name: newEmailAddress
parameters.description: If updating an existing contact, the contact's email address will be changed to this value. Provide the original email address in the `emailAddress` body field to select the existing contact.

application/json.message: An invalid value was supplied for {Parameter}.
Authorization was denied for this request.
Unable to locate a resource associated with the listId supplied.

parameters.name: segmentationFieldIds

x-code-samples.source:
var client = new HttpClient();

client.BaseAddress = new Uri("https://api.listrak.com/email/");
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.Add("Authorization", "Bearer " + token);

var response = await client.PostAsJsonAsync("v1/List", new
{
   ListName = null,
   FolderId = 0,
   IpPoolId = 0,
   BounceDomainAlias = null,
   BounceHandling = null,
   BounceUnsubscribeCount = 0,
   CreateDate =  0001-01-01T00=00=00 ,
   EnableBrowserLink = false,
   EnableDoubleOptIn = false,
   EnableDynamicContent = false,
   EnableGoogleAnalytics = false,
   EnableInternationalization = false,
   EnableListHygiene = false,
   EnableListRemovalHeader = false,
   EnableListRemovalLink = false,
   EnableListrakAnalytics = false,
   EnableSpamScorePersonalization = false,
   EnableToNamePersonalization = false,
   EnableUniversalEmailKeySetting = false,
   FromEmail = null,
   FromName = null,
   GoogleTrackingDomains = null,
   LinkDomainAlias = null,
   MediaDomainAlias = null
});

x-code-samples.source:
var client = new HttpClient();

client.BaseAddress = new Uri("https://api.listrak.com/email/");
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.Add("Authorization", "Bearer " + token);

var response = await client.PutAsJsonAsync("v1/List/{listId}", new
{
   ListName = null,
   FolderId = 0,
   IpPoolId = 0,
   BounceDomainAlias = null,
   BounceHandling = null,
   BounceUnsubscribeCount = 0,
   CreateDate =  0001-01-01T00=00=00 ,
   EnableBrowserLink = false,
   EnableDoubleOptIn = false,
   EnableDynamicContent = false,
   EnableGoogleAnalytics = false,
   EnableInternationalization = false,
   EnableListHygiene = false,
   EnableListRemovalHeader = false,
   EnableListRemovalLink = false,

   EnableUniversalEmailKeySetting = false,
   FromEmail = null,
   FromName = null,
   GoogleTrackingDomains = null,
   LinkDomainAlias = null,
   MediaDomainAlias = null
});

post.description: Creates and starts a new import for the specified list. HTTP request body lengths of up to 250 MB are permitted. Because the `fileStream` field must be encoded in Base64, and because the remainder of the JSON payload is counted against the 250 MB limit, the effective maximum import file size is approximately 185 MB (195,000,000 bytes); therefore, only attempt to import files up to 185 MB (195,000,000 bytes) in size.

parameters.description: Identifier used to locate the list.

parameters.name: listId
parameters.description: Identifier used to locate the list.

parameters.name: messageResource
parameters.description: Representation of the message to be sent.

parameters.name: sendDate
parameters.description: The send date for the message.

parameters.name: sendTestMessage
parameters.description: Whether a test message should be sent. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: sendReviewMessage
parameters.description: Whether a review message should be sent. The default value is `false`.

parameters.name: testEmailAddress
parameters.description: Test email address that will be used to preview the scheduled message.

x-code-samples.source:
var client = new HttpClient();

client.BaseAddress = new Uri("https://api.listrak.com/email/");
client.DefaultRequestHeaders.Add("Authorization", "Bearer " + token);

var response = await client.PostAsJsonAsync("v1/List/{listId}/Message?sendDate={sendDate}&sendTestMessage={sendTestMessage}&sendReviewMessage={sendReviewMessage}&testEmailAddress={testEmailAddress}", new
{
   Filter = null,
   BodyHtml = null,
   BodyText = null,
   CodePage = 0,
   EnablePassalong = false,
   EnableTracking = false,
   FromEmail = null,
   FromName = null,
   GoogleAnalyticsCampaignName = null,
   GoogleAnalyticsCampaignContent = null,
   ReplyEmail = null,
   ToName = null,
   EnableUniversalEmailKeySetting = false,
   CampaignId = 0,
   ExternalCampaignId = null,
   Subject = null
});

OAuth2.description:
Authentication is accomplished using OAuth 2.0. After successful authentication, your token should be included with every request using the _Bearer_ scheme; specifically, you should set your `Authorization` header value to `Bearer (Your token value)` in each request.

You may request a token by making a `POST` request to our token endpoint at `https://auth.listrak.com/OAuth2/Token`. The request should have a `Content-Type` of `x-www-form-urlencoded`, and the request body should include a `grant_type` of `client_credentials`, your `client_id`, and your `client_secret`. Here is an example of a valid request:

```
POST /OAuth2/Token
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded

grant_type: client_credentials
client_id: (Your client ID)
client_secret: (Your client secret)
```

For your security and convenience, you may pause and unpause your API access on our _Integrations_ page. All requests will be rejected while your API access is paused, including requests to issue tokens.

tags.name: Campaign
tags.description: A Campaign resource is used to group and track messages with a common theme or purpose.

tags.name: Contact
tags.description: The Contact resource is used to add, update and remove new contacts to a List. This resource also exposes the ability to set a contact's profile fields and subscription state.

tags.name: Conversation
tags.description: The Conversation resource allows you to access conversations that have been created on a list.

tags.name: ConversationMessage
tags.description: The Conversation Message resource allows you to access messages sent through a conversation.

tags.name: ConversationMessageActivity
tags.description: The Conversation Message Activity resource allows you to access contact activity for a message sent through a conversation.

tags.name: ConversationMessageLink
tags.description: The Conversation Message Link resource allows you to access links for a message sent through a conversation.

tags.name: ConversationMessageLinkClicker
tags.description: The Conversation Message Link Clicker resource allows you to access contacts that clicked a link in a message sent through a conversation.

tags.name: ConversationMessageSummary
tags.description: The Conversation Message Summary resource allows you to access an aggregated summary of contact activity for a message sent through a conversation.

tags.name: ConversationSummary
tags.description: The Conversation Summary resource allows you to access an aggregated summary of contact activity for a conversation.

tags.name: Event
tags.description: An Event resource provides a way to access external events that have been created on a list.

tags.name: EventGroup
tags.description: The EventGroup resource allows you to create containers which will contain and group events.

tags.name: Folder
tags.description: A Folder resource allows you to access the folders used to organize and group lists.

tags.name: IpPool
tags.description: The IpPool resource exposes all of the IP Pools and their IDs for a user's Account.

tags.name: List
tags.description:
Lists represent groupings of contacts, messages, and more.

Listrak's Email API is list-centric, just like Listrak's application. Most resources available through this API are associated with a specific list.

tags.name: ListImport
tags.description: The List Import resource is used to supply an import file in order to import data to a list.

tags.name: ListImportContact
tags.description: The List Import Contact resource allows you to access contacts that were affected as result of a list import.

tags.name: ListImportStatus
tags.description: The List Import Status resource allows you to access the status of a list import.

tags.name: ListImportSummary
tags.description: The List Import Summary resource allows you to access an aggregated summary of a list import.

tags.name: Message
MessageActivity
tags.description: The Message Activity resource allows you to access contact activity for a message.

tags.name: MessageLink
tags.description: The Message Link resource allows you to access links for a message.

tags.name: MessageLinkClicker
tags.description: The Message Link Clicker resource allows you to access contacts that clicked a link in a message.

tags.name: MessageStatus
tags.description: The Message Summary resource allows you to access an aggregated summary of contact activity for a message.

tags.name: MessageSummary
tags.description: The Message Summary resource allows you to access an aggregated summary of contact activity for a message.

tags.name: SavedAudience
tags.description: The Saved Audience resource allows you to access saved audiences that have been created on a list.

tags.name: SavedMessage
tags.description: The Saved Message resource allows you to access saved messages that have been created on a list.

tags.name: SegmentationField
tags.description: A Profile Field is used to store data about a contact so that it can be filtered in the future.

tags.name: SegmentationFieldGroup
tags.description: A Profile Field Group is used to group the profile fields for a given list.

tags.name: TransactionalMessage
tags.description: A Transactional Message resource provides a way to access transactional messages that have been created on a list.

tags.name: TransactionalMessageActivity
tags.description: The Transactional Message Activity resource allows you to access contact activity for a transactional message.
